benchmark_details.name: Wason Inductive Logic Test (WILT)
benchmark_details.overview: WILT is a multi-turn inductive logic benchmark designed to assess LLMsâ€™ ability to gather evidence and reason across multiple turns, requiring models to propose test cases and infer hidden rules.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To measure LLMs' multi-turn reasoning capabilities and gather evidence over multiple interactions.

data.source: Test cases generated based on the Wason 2-4-6 task principles.
data.size: 50 tests in full split, 10 tests in lite split
data.annotation: Manually constructed hidden rules and test cases.

methodology.calculation: Correct responses out of total tests attempted to diagnose reasoning capabilities.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better multi-turn reasoning.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated on both lite and full test splits.
